Thank you, Jack; anything you liked SPECIFICALLY in the TevFifty, or just 
the fact that it was playable (unlike Tryx)?

I think we're stuck with the super-fast characters... instead of considering 
it a handicap, I try to use it to my own advantage. For example, I'll have a 
character run toward a foe, shooting his weapon, and suddenly back off just 
before I run into him. The shots build up behind you, and as the enemy walks 
straight toward you, they hit him all at once like a ton of bricks. Brutal.

Ever notice how druids open doors faster than any other profession? Just 
imagine a druid planting a tree IN a door, its roots twisting through the 
framework and tearing at the hinges...

Chain lightning is a big problem for me. My old computer would freeze when I 
used it on too many foes; my newer one simply slows down to the point where 
it would take days for the lightning to run its course. On the one hand, if 
you're afraid to let a big chain lightning rip, it kinda brings down the 
incongruous power of the archmage... on the other, it's a plague on 
playability. If anything needs revision, I think this is it. A limit on the 
number of separate lightning bolts, maybe fifty, would be the most 
appropriate fix. Heh, if all these suggestions were implemented the game 
probably wouldn't run half as smoothly, so we should probably just accept 
what we have.
     -Tevildo, Prince of Cats.
